intro: Geranium nervifolium, commonly known as the slenderleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in partial shade and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
